typeDTO Data Type

Represents a type object in the system. This includes built-in types such as "incident" and "task", as well as custom types (Data Table)

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
actions partialActionDTO element 0/unbounded The list of actions defined for this type
display_name string element 0/1 The display name for the type.
export_key string element 0/1 This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this type
fields (custom) element 0/1 The fields supported for the type.
for_actions boolean element 1/1 True if an action can specify this type, false otherwise.
for_custom_fields boolean element 1/1 True if a custom field can be created for this type, false otherwise.
for_notifications boolean element 1/1 True if a notification can be created for this type, false otherwise.
id int element 0/1 The internal ID of the type.
parent_types string element 0/unbounded The list of names of parent types. For example, the parent type of "artifact" would be "incident". In the case of notes and attachments, the parent_types will contain both "task" and "incident". The parent type of a Data Table is "incident". This value is read-only except on create.
properties typePropertiesDTO element 0/1 Additional properties for the type.
scripts namedEntityDTO element 0/unbounded The list of scripts defined for this type
type_id int element 1/1 The internal type id of the type. For built-in types, the type id maps to the same value as the internal ID. For custom types (Data Table), the type id is mapped one-to-many and have internal IDs >= 1000 
 0 = INCIDENT
 1 = TASK
 2 = NOTE
 3 = MILESTONE
 4 = ARTIFACT
 5 = ATTACHMENT
 6 = ACTIONINVOCATION
 7 = ORGANIZATION
 8 = DATATABLE
type_name string element 0/1 The name of the type. For example, "incident" or "task".
uuid string element 0/1 The UUID for this type

Example

<typeDTO>
  <id>...</id>
  <type_id>...</type_id>
  <type_name>...</type_name>
  <fields>...</fields>
  <properties>
    <can_create>...</can_create>
    <can_destroy>...</can_destroy>
    <for_who>...</for_who>
  </properties>
  <parent_types>...</parent_types>
  <display_name>...</display_name>
  <for_notifications>...</for_notifications>
  <for_actions>...</for_actions>
  <for_custom_fields>...</for_custom_fields>
  <export_key>...</export_key>
  <uuid>...</uuid>
  <actions>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
    <type>...</type>
  </actions>
  <scripts>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </scripts>
</typeDTO>
